Package paoo.game.main

Class Sound

java.lang.Object
paoo.game.main.Sound
public class Sound extends Object
Manages audio playback for the game including background music and sound effects. This class provides functionality to load, play, loop, and control the volume of audio files. It supports various game sounds such as background music, UI sounds, and gameplay effects.

The Sound class uses Java's Sound API to handle WAV audio files and provides volume control through a scale-based system (0-5 scale mapped to decibel values).

  • Constructor Details

    • Sound

      public Sound()
      Constructs a new Sound manager and initializes all sound file URLs. This constructor loads references to all audio files used in the game:

      Sound file mapping: - Index 0: Background music for general gameplay - Index 1: Carrot pickup sound effect - Index 2: UI cursor/menu navigation sound - Index 3: Game over sound effect - Index 4: NPC speaking/dialogue sound - Index 5: Chest/door unlock sound effect - Index 6: Player damage received sound - Index 7: Monster hit/attack sound - Index 8: Victory/achievement fanfare sound

      All sound files are expected to be in WAV format and located in the "/sound/" resource directory.

  • Method Details

    • getVolumeScale

      public int getVolumeScale()
      Gets the current volume scale setting.
      Returns:
      the volume scale (0-5 where 0 is muted and 5 is maximum volume)

    • setVolumeScale

      public void setVolumeScale(int volumeScale)
      Sets the volume scale and updates the audio volume accordingly. The scale ranges from 0 (muted) to 5 (maximum volume).
      Parameters:
      volumeScale - the new volume scale (should be between 0-5)

    • setFile

      public void setFile(int i)
      Loads and prepares an audio file for playback. This method sets up the audio clip, opens the audio stream, and initializes volume control.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the sound file to load (corresponds to soundURL array indices)
      Throws:
      Exception - if there's an error loading the audio file or initializing the clip

      Usage example: - setFile(0) loads background music - setFile(1) loads carrot pickup sound - setFile(3) loads game over sound

    • play

      public void play()
      Starts playback of the currently loaded audio clip. The sound will play once from the beginning. For looping playback, use loop() instead.

    • loop

      public void loop()
      Starts continuous looping playback of the currently loaded audio clip. The sound will repeat indefinitely until stop() is called. This is typically used for background music.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops playback of the currently playing audio clip. This immediately halts audio playback and resets the clip position to the beginning.

    • checkVolume

      public void checkVolume()
      Updates the audio volume based on the current volume scale setting. This method converts the user-friendly volume scale (0-5) to decibel values that the audio system can understand.

      Volume scale mapping: - 0: -80dB (effectively muted) - 1: -20dB (very quiet) - 2: -12dB (quiet) - 3: -5dB (normal/default volume) - 4: +1dB (loud) - 5: +6dB (maximum volume)

      This method is automatically called when loading a new audio file and should be called after changing the volume scale.
